Key Arguments: Microsoft supports the Bill's objectives but suggests revisions for a more balanced and sustainable approach.
Challenges in defining misinformation and operationalizing those definitions are highlighted.
The scope of impacted services should be more focused, excluding enterprise services and low-virality platforms.
Transparency and measuring effectiveness need careful consideration to avoid low-quality data outputs.
The Bill should incorporate stronger review and oversight mechanisms.
Notable Quotes: Fighting misinformation requires a whole-of-society approach, as well as governance responses that are proportionate and targeted in nature.
The Bill should focus only on those services that are the most likely to facilitate the spread of online misinformation.
Requiring disparate services to conform to uniform or inflexible KPIs is unlikely to provide meaningful insight.
There are significant tensions between moderating content and protecting fundamental rights.
